page.title: 07Wild Ponies Of Exmoor
page.content: On Exmoor there are wild ponies,we went up to Stone Down to see Mr. Darby Haddon's herd of 50 mares and 4 stallions.The ponies live on the moor and are shy.They foal in the middle of May a mare can have about 25 foals in her lifetime.The ponies eat heather and grass,in the winter they are fed hay.We saw many different coloured ponies the dark ones stand the cold better.They are not pure bred Exmoor which are naughty and not very good for children.David Hill who looks after them said that they run quickly about 50 miles an hour and can jump over gates.Some have to be slaughtered for horsemeat.Ponies used to be very useful,pulling ploughs and gathering up the stock.It is sad that we don't need them so much these days.
